description.narrative: EAPR has strengthened capacity to influence allocation and management of regional and domestic plans, budgets and finances for children and adolescents., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EAPR effectively leverages and utilises resources, strategic partnerships, innovations, data and evidence to drive results for children

sector.narrative: Building global / regional / national stakeholder research capacity
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Technical assistance - Children in urban settings

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
East Asia and Pacific Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EAPR has strengthened capacity to influence allocation and management of regional and domestic plans, budgets and finances for children and adolescents.

description.narrative: SPEA improved capacities of EAPRO sectors and COs for more relevant Public Finance for Children (PF4C) engagements, and built and maintained important external partnership for an enabling environment for PF4C work at country level. A new PFM regional Facility was launched in partnership with the EU. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Regional advocacy initiatives undertaken by EAPRO on Headline (HL) Results Areas
Regional partners's sectoral plans/budgets that reflect child and gender related priorities based on UNICEF's advocacy and technical assistance
Number of Regional Office, Country Offices and partner institutions who benefit from capacity development events and knowledge platforms in research, PFM and impact evaluation
